result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark A. Denhartog Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mark A. Denhartog Jr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant, Mark A. Denhartog appeared with Attorney Martin Jarvis.  Attorney Thomas H Frost appeared for the State.  Court calls case and appearances.  Atty Jarvis offers a plea questionaire and waiver of rights form.  Court questions the def. re: his plea questionaire and waiver of rights form. Court finds the def. freely and knowingly waives his rights.  Court finds there is a factual basis. 
State moves to the amend the complaint in 15 CM 240 to remove the abusive section.  State speaks to the court. Atty Jarvis speaks to the court.  
15 CM 240-Def. pleas no contest. Court accepts plea and finds the def guilty. 
1 year probation. + costs. 60 DTP.

16 CM 71-Dismissed and Read-In
Status conference on June 20, 2016 at 09:45 am.

Defendant, Mark A. Denhartog appeared with Attorney Martin Jarvis.  Attorney Thomas H Frost appeared for the State.  Court calls case and appearances. Also has 15CM240 Waived reading. Not guilty plea is entered.  Bail will continue.  Status conference scheduled for June 20, 2016 at 09:45 am.
Status conference on April 4, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant, Mark A. Denhartog appeared with Attorney Martin Jarvis.  Attorney Thomas H Frost appeared for the State.  Court calls case and appearances.  Status from Atty Jarvis. Set out for a week to track w/ pending charges.  Status conference scheduled for April 4, 2016 at 10:00 am.
